xtft_charcode.h File Reference

Detailed Description

This file contains the macro and variable definitions of character dimensions and character array of bitmaps of ASCII characters.

 MODIFICATION HISTORY:

 Ver    Who   Date      Changes
 -----  ----  --------  -----------------------------------------------
 1.00a  sg    03/24/08  First release

#include "xil_types.h"
#include "xil_assert.h"

Defines

#define GenPixels(a7, a6, a5, a4, a3, a2, a1, a0)

Variables

u8 XTft_VidChars [96][12]

Define Documentation

#define GenPixels (  a7,
a6,
a5,
a4,
a3,
a2,
a1,
a0   ) 
 

Value:

(   ((a7) << 7) |       \
                ((a6) << 6) | ((a5) << 5) | ((a4) << 4) | ((a3) << 3) | \
                ((a2) << 2) | ((a1) << 1) | (a0)   )
Compression method for the character bitmaps.

Parameters:
a7 is bit value at 8th position.
a6 is bit value at 7th position.
a5 is bit value at 6th position.
a4 is bit value at 5th position.
a3 is bit value at 4th position.
a2 is bit value at 3rd position.
a1 is bit value at 2nd position.
a0 is bit value at 1st position.
Returns:
Bit Value - either 0 or 1.
Note:
C-style signature: int GenPixels(int a7, int a6, int a5, int a4, int a3, int a2, int a1, int a0).

Variable Documentation

u8 XTft_VidChars[96][12]
 

Character array of 96 characters with each character having dimensions of width 8 and height 12 pixels. It starts with space as first character.
